Loops, Arrays and Objects - Practical lesson tasks

P1 Shopping



const shoppingCart = [
  {
    name: "Apples",
    quantity: 3,
    price: 1
  },
  {
    name: "Bread",
    quantity: 1,
    price: 2
  },
  {
    name: "Milk",
    quantity: 2,
    price: 3
  }
];


const calculateTotalPrice = (cart) => {
  let totalPrice = 0;

  cart.forEach((item) => {
    const itemTotalPrice = item.quantity * item.price;
    totalPrice += itemTotalPrice;
  });

  return totalPrice;
};

const totalPrice = calculateTotalPrice(shoppingCart);

console.log("Total price:", totalPrice); // Output: 15.49

P2 Shopping food discount



const shoppingCart = [
  {
    name: "Apples",
    type: "food",
    quantity: 1,
    price: 1
  },
  {
    name: "Milk",
    type: "food",
    quantity: 1,
    price: 1
  },
];


const calculateTotalPrice = (cart) => {
  let totalPrice = 0;

  cart.forEach((item) => {

    if(item.type==="food"){const itemTotalPrice = item.quantity *(item.price*.8) ;
     totalPrice += itemTotalPrice;
    } else {
const itemTotalPrice = item.quantity *item.price
totalPrice += itemTotalPrice;
    }
    
    
  });

  return totalPrice;
};

const totalPrice = calculateTotalPrice(shoppingCart);

console.log("Total price:", totalPrice);

P3 General discount



const shoppingCart = [
  {
    name: "Apples",
    type: "food",
    quantity: 1,
    price: 1
  },
  {
    name: "Milk",
    type: "food",
    quantity: 1,
    price: 1
  },
];


const calculateTotalPrice = (cart,discountAmount,type) => {
  let totalPrice = 0;

  cart.forEach((item) => {

    const itemTotalPrice = item.quantity *item.price*(100-discountAmount)/100;
     totalPrice += itemTotalPrice;
    
  });

  return totalPrice;
};

const totalPrice = calculateTotalPrice(shoppingCart,20,"any");

console.log("Total price:", totalPrice);

P4 Shopping food price range



const shoppingCart = [
  {
    name: "Apples",
    type: "food",
    quantity: 1,
    price: 1
  },
  {
    name: "Milk",
    type: "food",
    quantity: 1,
    price: 1
  },
];


const calculateTotalPrice = (cart,discountAmount,type) => {
  let totalPrice = 0;

  cart.forEach((item) => {

    const itemTotalPrice = item.quantity *item.price*(100-discountAmount)/100;
     totalPrice += itemTotalPrice;
    
  });

  return totalPrice;
};

const totalPrice = calculateTotalPrice(shoppingCart,20,"any");

console.log("Total price:", totalPrice);

P5 Shopping food price range



const shoppingCart = [
 {
  name: "Apples",
  type: "food",
  quantity: 3,
  price: 6
 },
 {
  name: "Bread",
  type: "food",
  quantity: 1,
  price: 2
 },
 {
  name: "Milk",
  type: "food",
  quantity: 2,
  price: 3
 }
];


function filterItemsByPrice(cart, lowPrice, highPrice, quantity) {
 const arrItems = [];

 // Loop through each item in the cart
 for (const item of cart) {
   // Check if the item's price is in range
   if ((item.price >= lowPrice && item.price <= highPrice) || quantity===true) {
     arrItems.push(item);
   }
 }

 return arrItems;
}


const filteredItems = filterItemsByPrice(shoppingCart, 2, 5,false);
console.log(filteredItems);

Additional Tasks



  // Part 1
// Mean code task, got a function to caculate the mean then runs it. 
//

function calculateMean(numbers) {
  let sum = 0;
  let count = 0;

  // Iterate through the array using a for loop
  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {
    sum += numbers[i];  
    count++;            
  }

  // Calculate the mean and return it
  return sum / count;
}

let randomNumbers = [4, 6, 15, 2, 25, 3, 7];
// let randomNumbers = [6,5];
let average = calculateMean(randomNumbers);
console.log("Mean " +average);  
//*
// Mode code task, got a function to caculate the mode then runs it. 
//*
function findMode(numbers) {
  let countMap = {}; // Create a map to store counts of each number
  let modeValue = null;
  let maxCount = 0;

  // Count occurrences of each number
  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {
    const num = numbers[i];
    countMap[num] = (countMap[num] || 0) + 1; // Increment count or initialize to 1

    if (countMap[num] > maxCount) {
      modeValue = num;
      maxCount = countMap[num];
    }
  }

  // Display the mode
  console.log("Mode:", modeValue);
}

randomNumbers = [4, 6, 15, 2,6,6, 25, 3, 7,15];
findMode(randomNumbers);  

//
//Median 
//
function findMedian(numbers) {
  // Sort the numbers in ascending order
  const sortedNumbers = numbers.slice().sort((a, b) => a - b);

  // Calculate the middle index based on the length
  const middleIndex = Math.floor(sortedNumbers.length / 2);

  // Determine the median based on whether the length is odd or even
  const median = sortedNumbers.length % 2 === 0
    ? (sortedNumbers[middleIndex - 1] + sortedNumbers[middleIndex]) / 2
    : sortedNumbers[middleIndex];

  // Display the median
  console.log("Median:", median);
}

randomNumbers = [4, 6, 15, 2, 25, 3, 7];
findMedian(randomNumbers);  


//
//Part 2 - Function to choose which code to run, mode, median or mean 
//
function calculateStatistic(numbers, type) {
  switch (type) {
    case "mode":
      findMode(numbers);
      break;
    case "median":
      findMedian(numbers);
      break;
    case "mean":
      let average = calculateMean(numbers);
      console.log("Mean:", average);  // Adjust output format for consistency
      break;
    default:
      console.error("Invalid type:", type);
  }
}

 randomNumbers = [4, 6, 15, 2, 25, 3, 7];
calculateStatistic(randomNumbers, "mode");  // Output: Mode: 4
calculateStatistic(randomNumbers, "median"); // Output: Median: 4
calculateStatistic(randomNumbers, "mean");   // Output: Mean: 8.857142857142858
